page.title: 01Widdy Bank Fell
page.content: Widdy Bank Fell is part of the northern Pennines rising to 1716ft (532m). Its surface is rounded by vblanket peat and includes grass areas on the outcrops of Sugar Limestone. The western flank - the former Wheal - is inundated by Cow Green Reservoir. a retention dam blocking the flow of the river Tees on the Whinsill outcrop at the head of Cauldron Snout. At the footof this cascade the main stream is joined by Maize Beck, and then flows eastwards, then northwards throygh a deep glaciated trench passed Falcon Clints and then Crankley Scar-natural cliffs on the Whinsill - to Widdy Bank farm which controls the sheep grazing on the fell. Visitors are catered for by a Car Park, Toilets and fishing lodge at Cow Green.
